titles.title: Davis-Bacon Enforcement Act of 2005

To amend the Davis-Bacon Act to provide that a contractor under that Act who has repeated violations of the Act shall have its contract with the United States canceled and to require the disclosure under freedom of information provisions of Federal law of certain payroll information under contracts subject to the Davis-Bacon Act.

bill.summary:
Davis-Bacon Enforcement Act of 2005 - Amends the Davis-Bacon Act to require cancellation of federal contracts and a ten-year ineligibility period for contractors who have engaged in a pattern of intentional violations of such Act.
Requires, under federal law relating to freedom of information, disclosure of certain payroll information under contracts subject to the Davis-Bacon Act.
